<!-- Maze Path Finder Web Project Instructions -->

This is a Discrete Mathematics web project that demonstrates graph theory and DFS algorithm implementation.

## Project Overview
- **Title**: ðŸ§  Maze Path Finder â€“ A Discrete Mathematics Web Project
- **Tech Stack**: HTML, CSS (Grid/Flexbox), Vanilla JavaScript
- **Algorithm**: Depth-First Search (DFS)
- **Deployment**: Vercel-ready static files

## Key Features
- Interactive grid-based maze creation
- Visual DFS pathfinding algorithm
- Responsive design for mobile devices
- Educational focus on graph theory concepts

## File Structure
- `index.html` - Main application page
- `style.css` - Responsive styling with CSS Grid
- `script.js` - DFS algorithm and user interaction logic

## Development Notes
- Each grid cell represents a graph vertex
- Cell connections represent graph edges
- DFS recursively explores connected vertices
- Visual feedback shows algorithm progress
- Code includes educational comments explaining discrete math concepts
